GTTM_Analyser

Class MetricalStructureAnalyser

  • java.lang.Object
    • GTTM_Analyser.MetricalStructureAnalyser

  • public class MetricalStructureAnalyser
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton class providing methods for analysis of metrical preference rules. At the moment this class only includes preference rules for MPR5 a, b and d. MPR5 has different intrinsic strengths not described in great detail in the GTTM theory. These intrinsic strengths will need to be developed empirically.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MetricalStructureAnalyser getInstance()
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of this class

      • assessMPR5

        public double assessMPR5(java.util.List<Event> events,
                         AttackEvent event,
                         java.util.Map<Beat,Event> beatMap,
                         int level,
                         TimeSpanReductionBranch topTBranch)
                  throws MetricalAnalyserException
        Provides a rating based on application of the MPR5 rule. MPR5 contains a combination of different sub-considerations. This implementation makes use of MPR5a, MPR5b, and MPR5 c.
        Parameters:
        events - a list of Event objects which act as the context of Events mapped onto the metrical beat span
        event - an AttackEvent to be considered for candidacy of landing on a strong beat
        beatMap - a map of Beat objects against Event objects
        level - the level to check against the time-span reduction
        topTBranch - the time-span reduction structure top branch.
        Returns:
        a rating of how strongly a given event constitutes a candidate for landing on a strong beat.
        Throws:
        MetricalAnalyserException

      • assessMPR5a

        public double assessMPR5a(java.util.List<Event> events,
                          AttackEvent event)
        Provides a rating that describes how well the AttackEvent event ranks as a candidate for landing on a strong beat based on the mean length of events in the list events. This is an implementation of MPR5a
        Parameters:
        events - the list of events from which to calculate mean length
        event - the event to judge as a candidate for a strong beat
        Returns:
        a rating that indicates the candidacy of the given AttackEvent for landing on a strong beat. A rating of 0 indicates that the given AttackEvent is not a suitable candidate for landing on a strong beat. A rating of 1 indicates that the given AttackEvent is a very strong candidate for landing on a strong beat.

      • assessMPR5b

        public double assessMPR5b(java.util.List<Event> events,
                          AttackEvent event)
                   throws MetricalAnalyserException
        Assesses a given AttackEvent against a context of Events to assess whether the given AttackEvent constitutes a candidate for a strong beat. This is judged based on whether the given AttackEvent constitutes an AttackEvent that is at the inception of a relatively long duration of a dynamic.
        Parameters:
        events - the context of Event objects against which to assess the given AttackEvent
        event - AttackEvent to judge for candidacy for falling on a strong beat.
        Returns:
        a rating for how well the given AttackEvent is a candidate for landing on a strong beat.
        Throws:
        MetricalAnalyserException

      • assessMPR5c

        public double assessMPR5c(java.util.List<Event> events,
                          AttackEvent event)
                   throws MetricalAnalyserException
        Assesses how likely a given AttackEvent will land on a strong beat in the metrical structure given the context of Event objects. This method provides an assessment based on MPR5c, which makes an assessment based on whether the given AttackEvent marks an inception of a slur. If it is, it assesses whether it is the inception of a relatively long slur.
        Parameters:
        events - the context of Event objects against which to assess the candidacy of the AttackEvent
        event - the AttackEvent to be assessed
        Returns:
        a rating based on how likely the given AttackEvent is to land on a strong beat. If the AttackEvent is the inception of a relatively long slur, a ranking of 1.0 will be awarded. If it is not an inception, or is not of a relatively long duration, return 0.0. If is an average candidate, return 0.5.
        Throws:
        MetricalAnalyserException - thrown if the given AttackEvent is not contained within the list of Event objects.

      • assessMPR5d

        public double assessMPR5d(java.util.List<Event> events,
                          AttackEvent event)
                   throws MetricalAnalyserException
        Assesses how likely a given AttackEvent will land on a strong beat in the metrical structure given the context of Event objects. This method provides an assessment based on MPR5d, which makes an assessment based on whether the given AttackEvent marks an inception of a pattern of articulation. If it is, it assesses whether it is the inception of a relatively long pattern of articulation.
        Parameters:
        events - the context of Event objects against which to assess the candidacy of the AttackEvent
        event - the AttackEvent to be assessed
        Returns:
        a rating based on how likely the given AttackEvent is to land on a strong beat. If the AttackEvent is the inception of a relatively long pattern of inception, a ranking of 1.0 will be awarded. If it is not an inception, or is not of a relatively long duration, return 0.0. If is an average candidate, return 0.5.
        Throws:
        MetricalAnalyserException - thrown if the given AttackEvent is not contained within the list of Event objects.

      • assessMPR5e

        public double assessMPR5e(TimeSpanReductionBranch topBranch,
                          java.util.Map<Beat,Event> beatMap,
                          int level,
                          AttackEvent ev)
        Assesses how likely a given AttackEvent will land on a strong beat in the metrical structure given the context of Event objects. This method provides an assessment based on MPR5e, by identifying whether the AttackEvent forms 'a relatively long duration of a pitch in the relevant levels of the time-span reduction'.
        Parameters:
        topBranch - the top TimeSpanReduction branch of the piece
        beatMap - a map of Beat objects against Event objects
        level - the time-span reduction level to check the durational values for
        ev - the AttackEvent to be assessed
        Returns:
        a rating based on how likely the given AttackEvent is to land on a strong beat. If the AttackEvent is the inception of a relatively long pattern of inception, a ranking of 1.0 will be awarded. If it is not an inception, or is not of a relatively long duration, return 0.0. If is an average candidate, return 0.5.

      • getAllTimeSpanPitchEventsAtLevel

        public java.util.List<Event> getAllTimeSpanPitchEventsAtLevel(int level,
                                                              TimeSpanReductionBranch topBranch,
                                                              java.util.Map<Beat,Event> beatMap)
        Used to find all the AttackEvent objects present at the given level of the TimeSpanReduction
        Parameters:
        level - the level of the time-span reduction to check for
        topBranch - the top TimeSpanReductionBranch of the analysis
        beatMap - a map of Beat objects against Event objects
        Returns:
        the list of Event objects present at the given time span level.
